div.l: Of that he bribe can̄ or borwe may
Anon̄ he sent his bed and his array
Vnto a comper of his owne soort
That loued dys reuel and disport
And had a wif that helde for contenᵃaunce
A shoppe / and swyued for her sustenᵃaunce .
Here endith the Cookes tale~
And here beginneth the lawiers prolog with his tale folwing

div.l: The Ark of his artificiall day hath ronne
The iiij part and an half and houre ⁊and more
And thouȝ he were nouȝt depe I stert in lore
He wist it was the xviij day
Of Aprill that is massanger to May
And saw wel that the shadewe of eueri tree
Was as in lengthe the same quantite
That was the body erect that caused it
And therfor by the shadewe he toke his wit
That phebus which that shone ful clere and briȝt
Degrees was fyue and xlty clombe on hiȝt
And for that day as in that latitude
It was x of the clok he gan conclude
And sodeinly he pliȝt his horse aboute
Lordinges qd he I war you all this route
The iiij ꝑparty of this day is goon
Now for the loue of god and of seint Iohn
Leseth no tyme as ferforth as ye may
Lordinges the tyme is wasted niȝt and day
And steleth from vs what priuily sleping
And what throuȝ necligence in oure waking
As doth the streem that torneth neuer agein
Desending from the mountayn in to playn
